Reviews.Title: “Nice penthouse room”
Reviews.Author: pathfinderNj
Reviews.Content: I'd give this hotel 4 stars only for the larger and nicer of the penthouse rooms. It was bright, cheerful and comfortable, with a fun rooftop patio where you could watch the world go by. We got a discount rate, but it's worth paying a few extra dollars for. The other rooms look a bit plain and even dreary. I was ready to look elsewhere, but the penthouse room almost seemed to belong to a different hotel. There are a lot of stairs (and not always anyone around to help with bags), and it's a bit noisy at night. There seems to be a bit of soundproofing, and earplugs (or perhaps air conditioning) mostly solves that problem. As the previous review mentioned, I saw a few ants crawling up the doorframe in the bathroom, but none in the room, and certainly not enough to be disturbing. I don't know who the previous reviewer dealt with, either, because we only encountered one very nice, helpful lady who spoke excellent English. We arrived last-minute, and I looked at 3 other moderate hotels in the area. This one (at least the penthouse room) was by far the nicest for the price.

Reviews.Title: “awful treatment and plague”
Reviews.Author: ALOM87
Reviews.Content: We were planning to stay at this hotel, we had our room and all, and as one of us was about to take a shower she screamed, the reason? lots of flying ants were crawling around, over the walls, ceiling, floor and curtains. We went down stairs to management and they sent someone up to clean, they sprayed some insecticide and that killed them, apparently. A few minutes passed and as i now tried to take a shower, to my surprise it was filled with those ants once again, and lets face it, they're not the worse plague ever, but their bite sure hurts, so we complained in management once more and they changed our room to a much smaller one when we had the big room with 3 individual beds and a large bed. They changed us to a smaller room with 2 beds, of course paying the same price as the large room, which we didn't agree to, so we went to management to tell about our inconformity with the price, that it should be lower if the room was smaller and the manager said, well take your money back so rude that we couldn't believe our ears. I had to ask again, excuse me, did i hear correctly, are you kicking us out, he said yes, i can't do anything for you, our cleaning staff is out for the day, and i said that this wasn't a cleaning problem, the problem was that there was a plague crawling through the window, he just turned his face and ignored us, so i left, looked for the nearest hotel from there and checked out of there. As we went to get our money back we demanded to speak to the manager again cause he would give us the money, he sent someone else to do it. The last thing i wanted was to tell him that that wasn't the way to treat his guests, he snaped at us and started nagging and telling us that he couldn't grant us our extravagances and that we couldn't handle one small ant, of course all this time making faces at us, OMG, i was stunned that the man was actually talking to us that way, we said, look, it's not one ant, it was a plague ok? and really if you're not comfortable with your job its not our fault that you have to treat your costumers this badly and we left. Really, after the way that man treated us I really hope he's not working there anymore because one bad person is all it takes for people never want to go back to a place like that,

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Clean!!”
Reviews.Author: SunKisstManitoba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from playa del carmen yesterday. We had no reservations anywhere....and we stumbled upon Hotel Delphin. We had the junior suite. It was clean, comfortable and affordable. The staff was friendly and helpful. This hotel is ideally located and is a mere 2 minute walk from the beach. It is not too loud at night, but there is some noise from a nearby nightclub/lounge. Turning the air conditioner on fixes that!! We have no complaints about this hotel. If you are looking for an affordable, clean hotel with that mexican charm, Hotel Delphin is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Delfin is Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: shelleysharp10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so great - nothing too fancy but great location and nice accomodations for the inexpensive price. The room had 2 beds, air conditioner, refrigerator, adequate towels and space to hang your clothes. We watched Mariachi out of our window and had a blast! I will stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Charly007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last year for a week and this year for 5 days. The room once again was clean and spacious. The maids keep it clean on a daily bases. One block from the beach. Where you will find lots of sand and some great music from the Fusion Restaurant. 7 Eleven a few doors over for any snacks. Internet directly across the street. There are stairs so if you have an issue with the walking up or down this may not be your place. Daniel, owner, maintains things very nicely. He speaks English if you don't speak Spanish. Staff is friendly, counter staff speaks some English, cleaning staff speaks mostly Spanish. Thanks Daniel for another nice stay......

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: bennyscuba
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine basically fine for the price. The owner was very nice and easy to deal with. We arrived very late at night and they were more than accommodating. The room was large but basic. There is no communal space nor a pool. It also get be a bit a loud at night and in the morning. It is in the center of everything which is a plus and minus. In retrospect we would have preferred something higher up 5th ave...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok facilities, bad advertising”
Reviews.Author: bogogal
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel delfin on here and also through their website. I chose them because they offer free internet, well so their website and desk clerks say. They do not. I was looking for an extended stay while I look for an apartment and I had to have internet to work. When I checked in that night the person working did not know the password. No big deal I could wait until morning. In the morning I was given a password, but there was no internet connection. I tried two connections that were not the one that they told me, but as I figured the password did not work because it was not the hotel's. I have notified them of this and I was told that the internet works best in the lobby but does not reach me room at all. Kind of defeats of purpose of having internet in rooms advertised. I wasn't able to get a connection in the lobby either. Other than the it was good. Basic Mexican hotel. Clean, no frills, inexpensive and great location and friendly staff. Although I would avoid their sandal store. I didn't realize I was paying 500 pesos for a pair of basic rubber flipflops until after it was too late.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: dutchqt
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Delfin has two things going for it: cleanliness and cost. Staff wasn't extremely helpful as some reviews stated. The room was clean, had A/C and was inexpensive compared to other hotels in the vicinity. My main complaint is the photos on the Hotel Delfin website shows a penthouse, which we reserved, but there are two other penthouses and the other one we saw was not the one represented on the website. In addition, the "ocean view" was a view of rooftops and a bit of the ocean. The patio area is separated from the other penthouse with a stick fence and has no shade. We stayed in room #19. I don't recommend it if you have expectations of it looking like the photos! The sheets were stained, but that's something I found throughout my stay in the Yucatan, even at $300 a night cabanas.

Reviews.Title: “Clean confortable place”
Reviews.Author: Colin888
Reviews.Content: No Disco, No Bar, No Restaurant, Just clean cool comfortable rooms in primary location on the main street corner that couldn’t be closer to all that goes on in Playa Del Carmen. The owner’s Dan and Mirian, who built the hotel nearly twenty years ago, can tell you their favorite restaurants and hang outs of the locals or wonder in any direction and take in the melting pot of cultures and the independent shops they have created. Beach access is the closest you can get from 5th Ave (the Main Street). Bus access is close by and taxis wait across the street. I am also giving The Delfin a high rating for its ambiance and location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Delfin-La Quinta's best kept secret (not so secret anymore)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just three blocks from Playa del Carmen bus station and one block from the white sandy beaches of Mexico's Caribbean coast, Hotel Delfin is the perfect place to stay on La Quinta Avenida. Hotel Delfin is located in all of the action, but finding peace and relaxation is easy as well. Hotel Delfin took my reservations with less than a week's notice and Daniel and Roberto provided incredible service...our room was cleaned daily to perfection and the simple but charming rooms provided the perfect central location for myself and my four 25-year old friends to hang out between lying on the beach, shopping, renting motor-scooters and dining out and enjoying Mexico's finest tequila! This is the perfect small and affordable hotel in Playa del Carmen. This was my third trip to Playa and my third hotel... it was muy Bueno!

Reviews.Title: “For the best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think there are at least two types of travelers. One kind goes to places like Mexico and goes to places that, besides the warm beachers, could be the US. The food is Mexicanized, so there are tacos and such, and you can go with little interaction with what's happening locally. Playa Del Carmen is a rocking city. There are hundreds of restaurants, including one in a cave. There are many fun shops and people come from all over the world. There are far more Canadians and Italians there than US Americans. Hotel Delfin is located right on the main street of town, so you just walk out the door and you in in the middle of the fun. It is 1/2 block or so from the beach, so if you want to hang out on the beach, it is right there. The hotel is solidly built, so if you decide that all the activity in the town (many nightclubs, music venues, and general fun) is a bit much and you want to get a good night's sleep, it is no problem, inside it is clean and quiet. In an all inclusive, you might be anywhere, but if you experience Playa Del Carmen, you will never forget it. Hotel Delfin is probably the best hotel in Playa for having your cake and eating it too.

Reviews.Title: “delfin is okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location, was quite clean, with big rooms and comfortable beds. However, it was overpriced for the amenities. We booked through our travel agent and paid there and it was $ 70 US(maybe you could negotiate a better price if you booked directly through hotel). Our room had two queen beds, no balcony, and threadbare towels/linens plus there was no elevator(3story bldg), no restaurant,no bar, or gardens or common area. Considering the prices of properties within a block of this one, it was much more expensive.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Delfin
HotelInfo.Address: 5th Avenue, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
